DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of statin therapy for prevention of atrial fibrillation (AF) in pacemaker and non-pacemaker patients with paroxysmal atrial fibrillation in the absence of significant coronary artery disease.
DOC.brief_title: Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation: Role of Inflammation, Oxidative Stress Injury and Effect of Statins
DOC.detailed_description: Patients with a history of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, with or without a dual chamber pacemaker and who meet all study criteria, will be randomized to receive either a placebo, or simvastatin 40 mg, daily for 6 months. Liver enzymes are drawn at randomization and 3 months. CRP and oxidative stress products are drawn at randomization, weekly for the first month and then monthly for 5 months. Patients transmit their rhythm, twice daily for 5 consecutive days at randomization, then 5 consecutive days monthly for 6 months. Clinic visits are required at randomization, 3 months and 6 months.
DOC.criteria: Patients with paroxysmal AF (> 3 epis each > 15 min in length) over 6 months Patients on stable antiarrhythmic drug therapy and life expectancy > 1 year Patients with PAF due to reversible cause Chronic inflammatory conditions Other medical conditions requiring statin therapy Patients on amiodarone or verapamil Elevated CK or ALT Life expectancy <1 year TAVN ablation Geographic isolation Inability to give informed consent
